issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: Strictly define the expected behavior of filesystem APIs and write tests to verify compliance

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A patch for this issue has been uploaded to JIRA by a contributor.
status.name: Patch Available

fields.description:
According to https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-9438,
FileSystem#mkdirs and FileContext#mkdir do not throw FileAlreadyExistsException if the directory already exist.

Some places in the mapreduce codebase assumes FileSystem#mkdirs or FileContext#mkdir throw FileAlreadyExistsException.
At least the following files are concerned:
 - YarnChild.java
 - JobHistoryEverntHandler.java
 - HistoryFileManager.java

It would be good to re-review and patch this if needed.
fields.summary: FileAlreadyExistsException is assumed to be thrown by FileSystem#mkdirs or FileContext#mkdir in the codebase

It was mainly about removing catch() {} with a logging statement inside.
No need to add test cases for it.
mark up as related to HADOOP-9361 as a diff between filesystem contract and expected behaviour downstream
